nodes.bodyText: picky, but I'd suggest ordering these in some logical way.  also, startGCJson I believe only applies to logstashCollector, so should perhaps follow the naming convention you have for the other related logstashCollector strings.
should include GC in this consistency sweep up.
convention for static constants is to use all upper case
convention for static constants is to use all upper case
I think we could now rename these startXXXJSONFields methods to just startXXX since there's just one for each type
this one might just be personal taste, but I prefer to define variables right before I use them... that way I can easily tell where that variable starts getting used

I think you answered this once before -- is there reason we're able to not convert to Strings for each of these values?  Just want to make sure we don't change what gets quotes around values and what doesn't.

Sorry, I'm very unfamiliar with how the extension fields work. Maybe Ellen or Yushan can offer more insight on this (I'm mainly just going through the motions of replacing all addToJSON with jsonBuilders and mimicking the previous behaviour as much as possible)

ok, looking at the addToJSON method, I think what you're doing is equivalent.  The last parameter in the addToJSON calls was indicating that the numeric values should be added without adding quotes around the values in the JSON.  Similarly, the code in jsonBuilder.addField would add those numeric values without quotes around the values.

Originally NAMES1_1 referred to the set of names used for JSON and logstashCollector-1.1 (which we got rid of), and NAMES referred to the set of names used for logstashCollector-1.0.  Can you please rename NAMES1_1 / NAMES to NAMES_JSON / NAMES_LC (across all of these XXXData.java files)?

                                             LogFieldConstants.HOSTNAME,
                                             LogFieldConstants.WLPUSERDIR,
-                                            LogFieldConstants.SERVERNAME
+                                            LogFieldConstants.SERVERNAME,
+                                            LogFieldConstants.TYPE
     };

nodes.bodyText: I don't think these fields are used... are they?  it scared me for a min to see fields in the NAMES_JSON without the IBM_ prefix (other than type / host).  For the fields that aren't used, I wonder if we should put in a dummy value to avoid them easily slipping into the code without being noticed.

nodes.bodyText:
no, that's exactly the right list of fields to see in an ffdc JSON.  message is a special case that we didn't add an ibm_ prefix to because it makes it fit better with other events that you might want to show in the same views.
So, that said, I'm wondering if we should block out the field names we don't use (eg. with a constant like "XXXXXXX" rather than fill in the array with invalid (but harder to notice) ones?
